topic.title: 1MB filesize limit
topic.body:
Is the 1MB filesize limit still active or has it been fixed/improved already?
Does it apply to optional content?

6_1QBLGLcgKfcpfLmiDYuDzUKVXFfmTAew55.body:
I haven't done this myself but:

Maybe you could get yourself a cheap VPS (torrenting allowed) or portforward your home-machine and use those instructions: http://zeronet.readthedocs.org/en/latest/faq/

Scroll down to "Is it possible to install ZeroNet to a remote machine?" to get some more info and how to password-protect this service.

Oh forgot:
There are public gateways such as the other people here mentioned:

    http://bit.no.com:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit
    http://zero.pags.to:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit

Thanks to nofishme on reddit (who posted those)

1_13pAK1jj4Qwt56ytnn5BorrMfHA7J3Nc8C.body:
> [nofish](#comment_304_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Large files still not supported. Around 40% of peers are using Tor and it's not a good idea to send big files over it, so better use Torrent or similar to distribute large files.

What about 2~3MB files?
